intro: Osbeckia sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Osbeckia sikkimensis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties.
